title: The Normalization Nexus
story: Features with different scales can hurt ML models! Normalization (scaling to 0-1) and standardization (mean=0, std=1) ensure all features contribute fairly. Min-max normalization formula: (x - min) / (max - min). This is crucial preprocessing!
instructions: Import numpy as np. Create `data` with [10, 20, 30, 40, 50]. Calculate `min_val` (minimum), `max_val` (maximum), and `normalized` using min-max formula. Also calculate `mean_val`, `std_val`, and `standardized` = (data - mean) / std. Print normalized and standardized.
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np
data = np.array([10, 20, 30, 40, 50])
min_val = data.min()
max_val = data.max()
normalized = (data - min_val) / (max_val - min_val)
mean_val = data.mean()
std_val = data.std()
standardized = (data - mean_val) / std_val
print(normalized)
print(standardized)

hints.text: Min-max: (data - min) / (max - min). Z-score: (data - mean) / std
normalized = (data - data.min()) / (data.max() - data.min()), standardized = (data - data.mean()) / data.std()
